TopicTitle: Hardest Weekly Challenge Goal Should Be Jeb Level

Articles.Content:
Right now the hardest weekly challenge is the Val-level goal. No slander on Val, but Jeb is in fact the greatest pilot who has ever lived. 
 

I am objectively correct- but interested in the community’s thoughts regardless.

The answer to this is obvious, and everyone on the forum knows it (no matter what they say out loud). Jeb was always first. Female Kerbals were added later because their omission was glaring (though many would argue that Kerbals had no gender at that point). Everyone loves Val, but Jeb is Jeb (ever hear of Mechval?). The problem with threads like this, however light-hearted their intent, is that they will devolve into weird arguments about things that have no place in a gaming forum.

In summary, if you're gonna make this argument, the best way to do it is just to say "Jeb-level sounds better than Val-level". Which it does.

This could indeed go very toxic, very quickly.  

The Kerbal Astronaut Corps culture in my head has always been kind of like the Corvette racing/massive drunken party at the Outpost scene in Episode 1 of For All Mankind - lots of buzz cuts, barbecues, buzzing the tower, spiffy sixties menswear, heavy drinking in Tiki bars, aviator sunglasses, and fast cars, but this is just projecting the fun pop culture aspects of the glory days of the Space Race onto KSP.  It has nothing to do with any aspect of the US culture war.

In my KSP1 Career saves, I’d always give Jeb and Val alternate missions.  Having two equally qualified pilots only makes sense, and looping back to For All Mankind (possibly the most Kerbal show on TV), I envision the Jeb and Val relationship as being exactly like the Ed and Molly friendship in FAM: one based on mutual respect and admiration, love of job, heavy drinking and loose regard for the rules.  Ranking the two BadS kerbonauts, or otherwise contaminating my shiny happy optimistic KSP headvibe with toxic culture war fallout, is silly, pointless and nothing that I intend to do.

Jeb was the star of KSP1, Val is the star of KSP2, but in all honesty I think the two of them really wouldn't care one bit about some dumb human ranking of them, they're both professional thrill-seekers far more concerned about actually getting out and doing things.

Edited March 18, 2023 by regex
Agree that this could turn toxic quickly. Maybe Val's challenges are more technical and complicated, while Jeb's are riskier and more space cowboy in nature?

but in all honesty I think the two of them really wouldn't care one bit about some dumb human ranking of them

A long time ago I crashed my bike on a racetrack, I crashed while trying to keep up with the wife. I've come to terms as to who really is the better pilot. 

So who'd you choose to share a command pod with and feel safer?

I’m 6’2”.  I wouldn’t even fit into a command pod of any size.  I’d need one of those double long Hitchiker cans at a minimum, and the lack of life support would be a total dealbreaker.
